turns.content: I'm planning a grocery trip to Walmart this weekend and I'm trying to make a list of essentials. Can you help me with that? By the way, I just used a 20% off coupon on my last trip to Walmart last Sunday, which saved me $12 on my $60 bill.

I'd be happy to help you with that. However, I have to clarify that I'm a large language model, I don't have access to your personal experiences or previous purchases, so I didn't know you went to Walmart last Sunday or used a 20% off coupon. That's great that you were able to save $12 on your bill, though!

Now, let's focus on making a list of essentials for your upcoming trip to Walmart. Here are some common grocery items that people often need:

1. Fresh produce:
	* Fresh fruits (apples, bananas, carrots, etc.)
	* Fresh vegetables (lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc.)
	* Salad mix
2. Dairy and eggs:
	* Milk
	* Yogurt
	* Cheese (shredded, block, or string)
	* Eggs
3. Meat and poultry:
	* Chicken breast or thighs
	* Ground beef or turkey
	* Pork sausage or bacon
	* Fish (fresh or frozen)
4. Bread and grains:
	* Bread (white or whole wheat)
	* Pasta
	* Rice
	* Oatmeal or cereal
5. Pantry items:
	* Canned goods (beans, tomatoes, soups, etc.)
	* Peanut butter or jelly
	* Nuts or seeds
	* Baking supplies (flour, sugar, etc.)
6. Beverages:
	* Juice (orange, apple, or cranberry)
	* Soda or sparkling water
	* Coffee or tea
	* Milk alternatives (almond, soy, or oat milk)
7. Snacks:
	* Chips or crackers
	* Fresh fruit or cut veggies with dip
	* Granola or energy bars
	* Trail mix
8. Personal care items:
	* Toilet paper
	* Paper towels
	* Shampoo and conditioner
	* Toothpaste and toothbrushes
9. Household essentials:
	* Laundry detergent
	* Dish soap
	* Trash bags
	* Cleaning supplies (detergents, wipes, etc.)

Feel free to add or remove items based on your personal preferences and dietary needs. You can also consider any sales or promotions that might be happening at Walmart to plan your shopping trip accordingly. Happy shopping!
I'm actually looking for some specific items like paper towels, toilet paper, and shampoo. Do you have any recommendations for those?

I'd be happy to help you with that.

For paper towels, toilet paper, and shampoo, here are some popular and affordable options available at Walmart:

**Paper Towels:**

* Bounty Paper Towels (Various sizes and quantities) - A popular choice for their durability and absorbency.
* Great Value Paper Towels (Walmart's store brand) - A budget-friendly option that's still reliable and effective.

**Toilet Paper:**

* Charmin Ultra Soft Toilet Paper (Various sizes and quantities) - Known for its comfort and durability.
* Great Value Toilet Paper (Walmart's store brand) - Another affordable option that's still a great value.

**Shampoo:**

* Pantene Pro-V Shampoo (Various formulas and sizes) - A popular choice for its nourishing and moisturizing properties.
* TRESemmé Shampoo (Various formulas and sizes) - Another well-known brand that offers a range of formulas for different hair types.
* Suave Professionals Shampoo (Various formulas and sizes) - A budget-friendly option that still offers great results.

These are just a few examples, but there are many other options available at Walmart depending on your personal preferences and needs. If you have specific skin or hair types, you may want to consider other brands or formulas that cater to those needs.

I hope this helps you plan your shopping trip!

I'm looking for something similar to what I bought last time, which was a household essentials bundle that included toilet paper and paper towels. Do you know if they have anything like that on sale this week? And by the way, the 20% off coupon I used last Sunday was for my entire purchase, so I was able to save on everything I bought, including the household essentials.

I'm happy to help you with that. However, I'm a large language model, I don't have real-time access to Walmart's current sales and promotions. But I can suggest a few options to help you find what you're looking for:

1. **Walmart's Website:** You can check Walmart's website (walmart.com) for their current sales and promotions. They usually have a "Weekly Ad" or "Rolling Back" section that highlights their latest deals. You can also search for "household essentials bundle" or "toilet paper and paper towels bundle" to see if they have any relevant offers.
2. **Walmart's App:** If you have the Walmart app, you can check their weekly ad, browse sales, and even build a shopping list. You can also use the app to find items in-store and check prices.
3. **In-Store:** When you visit Walmart this weekend, you can check the household essentials aisle for any bundled deals or promotions. You can also ask a store associate if they have any sales or discounts on toilet paper and paper towels.

Regarding the 20% off coupon, that's great that you were able to save on your entire purchase! However, as a digital AI assistant, I don't have access to your personal shopping history or coupon usage. But I'm always here to help you with any questions or shopping-related queries you may have!

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
I will check their website and app to see if they have any deals on household essentials bundles. Do you know if they offer any digital coupons or loyalty rewards that I can use on my purchase?

Walmart does offer digital coupons and loyalty rewards that can help you save even more on your purchase. Here are a few options:

1. **Walmart Digital Coupons:** Walmart offers digital coupons that you can load onto your Walmart account or mobile app. These coupons are usually store-wide and can be used on eligible items. You can find digital coupons on Walmart's website or through their app.
2. ** Ibotta:** Ibotta is a popular cashback app that partners with Walmart. You can browse Ibotta's offers, add them to your account, and then shop at Walmart to earn cashback on your purchases.
3. **Fetch Rewards:** Fetch Rewards is another cashback app that partners with Walmart. You can earn points on your Walmart purchases, which can be redeemed for cash or other rewards.
4. **Walmart+:** Walmart+ is a paid membership program that offers exclusive benefits, including unlimited free delivery, fuel discounts, and mobile checkout. While it's not a traditional loyalty program, it can provide significant savings for frequent Walmart shoppers.
5. **Walmart App Offers:** The Walmart app often features exclusive offers, discounts, or rollbacks on various items. You can browse the app's "Deals" or "Savings" section to find these offers.

Remember to always check the terms and conditions of each offer to ensure it's valid on your household essentials bundle.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any more questions.

I'll definitely check out those options. I'm hoping to find a good deal on the household essentials bundle, and maybe even stack it with a digital coupon or loyalty reward. I'm sure I'll be able to save even more than the $12 I saved last Sunday with that 20% off coupon.

That's the right attitude! Stacking deals and discounts can really add up to significant savings. I'm confident you'll find a great deal on the household essentials bundle, and combining it with a digital coupon or loyalty reward will only sweeten the deal.

Remember to also keep an eye out for any sales tax or cashback rewards that might be available in your area. Every little bit counts, and it's great that you're being mindful of your spending and looking for ways to save.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask. Otherwise, happy shopping, and I hope you score an amazing deal on your household essentials bundle!

I'm thinking of buying some shampoo and conditioner while I'm at Walmart. Do you know if they have any good deals on those items? And by the way, I was able to use that 20% off coupon on my entire purchase last Sunday, including the household essentials, which was really helpful.

Shampoo and conditioner are essentials, indeed!

As for deals on shampoo and conditioner, Walmart often has sales and promotions on personal care items. However, I don't have real-time access to their current sales and promotions. But I can suggest a few options to help you find deals:

1. **Walmart's Website:** Check Walmart's website for sales and promotions on shampoo and conditioner. You can filter by brand, price, and customer reviews.
2. **Walmart App:** Use the Walmart app to browse sales and promotions on shampoo and conditioner. You can also use the app to check prices and find items in-store.
3. **In-Store:** When you visit Walmart, check the personal care aisle for sales and promotions on shampoo and conditioner. You can also ask a store associate if they have any deals or discounts available.

Regarding the 20% off coupon, that's great that you were able to use it on your entire purchase, including the household essentials! However, as a digital AI assistant, I don't have access to your personal shopping history or coupon usage. I'm here to provide general information and guidance, but I don't retain information about individual shoppers or their purchases.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
